social_posts.post_text:
REAL TALK! 
Ask questions in the comments or send me a dm anytime, I do answer!

I’m Chef Sara, and I am an imperfect vegan.👋
Recently I shared in my stories a pic of my first cookout of the year. Shockingly, on one side of the grill were some non-vegan items and on the other were vegan burgers and dogs. This is because my kids do eat some animal products! Although I am vegan, I do not force my kids to be. As a Mother, forcing kids to eat certain foods does not resinate with me. I prefer to teach them moderation and balance. And as a Chef, cooking meat is ok since I have done it for so many years in restaurants. I was nervous about backlash from my vegan community but I value transparency and authenticity. A vegan follower/friend of mine reached out and was surprisingly supportive saying she also thought it was important for people to see. I want people to know that you can go vegan, or just eat vegan food more often without forcing your kids or spouse to do so. It is ok to do what you can do, it will still make an impact on the environment, your health and the level of compassion in the world. 

TBH, I strive to create recipes that entice non-vegans to eat vegan meals! That is one of my big motivators and goals. Just getting people to eat more plants. If you try my recipe and decide you want to plop your protein of choice on top, that’s ok with me. I have still succeeded in my goal of getting you to eat a bigger variety of plants and over time, it’s likely that your preferences will change and you will naturally eat less meat and dairy and maybe just maybe you might try going vegan. That is what I hope for with my kids. And that is my hope for you. Although I am vegan, I have no interest in shaming or forcing others to be.

I am a MOTHER and a CHEF. I love creating vegan recipes that people enjoy eating. That is what my platform was intended for. I hope you stay knowing that I drink Starbucks out of disposable cups, enjoy a beer on the weekend, and feed my family the things they like to eat instead of making them eat quinoa 24/7. JUST KEEPING IT REAL. ✌️
-Sa

VEGAN CHILE RELLENOS

Can you believe this is vegan?
 
For my favorite Mexican treat, CHILE RELLENOS I used a blend of vegan Cheeses and they came out insane! The flavor and texture is on point. I never thought I could indulge like this after going plant-based. 

P.S. my husband and I eloped in 2012 but someday we will have a party and renew our vows, and this is the song I want us to dance to💃❤️

RECIPE
Ready in 35 minutes
Ingredients: 
4 poblano chiles roasted, peeled and deseeded
4 oz Cheddar shreds 
4 oz Mozzarella shreds 
4 oz  Pepper Jack (I used @goodplanetfoods snackable wedges)
1 cup chickpea flour
1 cup water
1 tsp baking powder
½ tsp salt
1 tbsp coconut oil
2 tbsp olive oil
Instructions:
-Roast chiles over flame until blackened then place in a covered bowl to rest until cool.
-Meanwhile mix chickpea flour, water, baking powder and salt to make the batter and set aside.
-Next, carefully peel the blackened chiles under a slow drip faucet.
-Once cleaned, split the chile with a knife along one side to make a pocket for the cheese. For a milder chile deseed by rinsing.
-Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
-Hold chile in one hand and stuff full of cheese with equal parts cheddar, mozzarella and pepper jack, continue until all are stuffed. Secure with a toothpick or skewer.
-In a deep saute pan, heat oil to medium heat to prepare for shallow frying.
-Rake stuffed chile thru batter, then place in the hot pan. Fry for about 3-4 minutes each side until golden, then place on a sheet pan and bake for 5 minutes in the oven to finish.

EASY AIR-FRIED STREET CORN

You will love this Mexican inspired street corn! The air-fryer makes the corn crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside. It really is perfection. Try it and thank me later🌽

RECIPE
Serves 5
Ready in 20 min
Ingredients:
-5 ears of corn peeled and chopped in thirds
-2-3 sprays olive oil
-3 tbsp vegan mayo
-1 lime halved 
-1 lime cut in wedges
-1/4 tsp chili lime seasoning or tajin plus more to taste
-1 pinch salt
-2 green onions chopped
-1/4 bunch cilantro chopped
-1/4 cup vegan feta crumbled
Instructions:
-Air fry corn at 400 for 16 minutes, turning once halfway
-To make chili lime aioli, combine vegan mayo, juice of one lime, pinch of salt, chili seasoning and 2 tsp water until mixed well
-once corn is cooked, drizzle with aioli, green onion and cilantro, vegan cheese and chili seasoning and lime

#mexicancorn #veganized #streetcorn #airfryerrecipe #cincodemayo #cookingvideos

VEGAN ENCHILADAS VERDES

Follow @betterfoodguru for the tastiest plant-based recipes

Cinco de Mayo means Mexican food at our house and this easy and incredibly delicious vegan Mexican inspired recipe is everything. The slightly spicy salsa verde clings to the warm tortillas perfectly and the crumbled tofu filling is tasty and easy to make. I used vegan cheese and sour cream and gf tortillas but you do you. Feliz Cinco 🇲🇽

RECIPE
Makes 6 large enchiladas 
Ready in 1 hour
ENCHILADA SALSA VERDE 
1 tsp olive oil
6 tomatillos peeled
1 onion peeled and halved
3 garlic cloves peeled
1 jalapeno halved
1 cup water
1/2 bunch cilantro
1 tsp cornstarch
1 pinch salt
*Roast onions, garlic, jalapeño and tomatillos on a sheet pan at 400 degrees for 20 mins
*Put roasted onion, garlic, jalapeño and tomatillos in a blender with water, cilantro, cornstarch and salt 
*Blend til smooth
TOFU FILLING
1 pack xtra firm tofu drained and crumbled
1 cup frozen corn
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp smoked paprika
1/2 tsp chili powder
1 tbsp olive oil
*Heat oil in a large, deep sauté pan
*add tofu and spices and cook for 5-7 minutes until browning
*add corn and cook 3-4 more minutes
ASSEMBLY
6 large burrito sized tortillas or 12 small corn tortillas
3 cups vegan grated cheddar cheese
*Heat the tortillas for 2 minutes on each side with a little oil to “seal” them so they don’t disintegrate from the sauce
*spray a casserole pan with olive oil then roll each warmed tortilla with vegan cheese and tofu filling.  Top with salsa, more vegan cheese and tin foil. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes.

OPTIONAL BUT RECOMMENDED TOPPINGS:
Vegan sour cream
Chopped cilantro and jalapenos
Lime wedges
Hot sauce

STRAWBERRY AND (VEGAN) FETA SALAD 

Save and follow @betterfoodguru for more salads that slap

The Spring produce is poppin and we got some super sweet strawbs from the market to play with. First thing that comes to mind is this super delicious summery salad recipe for balsamic strawberry salad that you will love. It’s sweet, salty, tangy and fresh with pops of mint. OBSESSED!

PS Happy Sunday. It’s another day at the ballpark watching my little people play ball. By the end of May 2023 I will have spent more time in a sports setting than I did in my whole life combined! I am so siked that its 70 degrees and sunny. Way better than last week that was cold and rainy!
Prep: 10 Minutes
Serves: 2 meal salad or 4 side salads
Ingredients:
2 persian cucumbers chopped
10 strawberries sliced
8 oz bagged pre-washed baby spinach
¼ red onion sliced thin
¼ head red cabbage shredded (about 1 ½  cups)
6 fresh mint leaves julienned
2 tbsp balsamic vinegar
½ lemon squeezed
pinch salt
fresh ground black pepper
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
½ cup vegan feta (or regular)
Instructions
1. Chop cucumber, slice onion, shred cabbage, and julienne mint.
2. Add to a large mixing bowl with baby spinach
3. Drizzle balsamic vinegar, lemon, olive oil, salt and pepper then mix with hands or tongs
4. Top with chopped avocado, feta and more black pepper
5. Serve immediately

READ THE CAPTION to learn why cabbage is in my top 5 salad ingredients:

1. It stays crunchy even after dressing. This makes it ideal for mixed salads and meal prep. It doesn’t break down and get wilty like lettuce or spinach. That’s why I use it as a base for so many of my make ahead salads.

2. It is cheap and lasts a long time. A head of cabbage costs a couple bucks and yields a-lot of shredded cabbage once you cut it. But, you can cut a quarter at a time and the part that isn’t cut will last weeks in the fridge. I always have cabbage on hand. 

3. It’s colorful and pretty which also means it’s good for you. It is packed full of antioxidants, it is considered anti-inflammatory, it’s high fiber and may even prevent diabetes and high cholesterol. 

4. It tastes great! The flavor of cabbage is really mild and versatile. It is awesome in salads, stir fries, and even as a wrap if you are eating low carb. Just peel off the outer big leaves and use them like a crunchy tortilla! It’s so good.

Do you like cabbage?

Italian Vegetable Farro Salad

Save this reel and Follow @betterfoodguru for all salad yums

Getting the salad vibes rolling with this Farro salad. Move over antipasto there’s a new gal in town. This one is full of Italian inspired flavors like bell peppers, tomatoes, artichoke hearts and olives. Plus it had hearty farro which is so delicious in a salad and is perfect for meal prep and make ahead salads. And it’s vegan! 🥦

Serves 6
Ready in 40 minutes
Ingredients:
8 oz dried farro
For Roasted Veg:
1/2 head cauliflower cut in florets
10 baby bell peppers halved
5 baby bell peppers whole
1 tsp olive oil
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/4 tsp salt
Few grinds fresh black pepper
For Dressing:
5 Roasted baby bell peppers
2 tbsp olive oil
2 tbsp red wine vinegar
1 tbsp maple syrup
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 tsp oregano
For Salad
1/2 head dinosaur kale shredded
20 cherry tomatoes halved
1/2 English cucumber cut in rounds
1/2 cup calamata and green olives pitted and sliced
1/2 cup artichoke hearts
Instructions:
1. Cook Farro according to directions then let cool
2. Preheat oven to 400
3. On a sheet pan spread cauliflower florets, halved baby bell peppers and whole baby bell peppers. Spray with olive oil, sprinkle with salt, garlic powder and pepper. Mix until well coated and bake for 20 minutes. Let cool.
4. Make the dressing in a blender with roasted whole baby peppers (remove stems) red wine vinegar, olive oil, maple syrup, salt and oregano. Blend until smooth and creamy.
5. In a large bowl, add kale, cooled farro, roasted baby bells (cut small) roasted cauliflower, tomatoes, cucumbers, artichoke hearts and olives. Pour dressing over the salad and mix well.

KALE AND ORZO SALAD

Save this recipe and FOLLOW @betterfoodguru if salad queen is on your bucket list

Special shoutout to Janice Chapler of the Westside Cafe in Berkeley for sharing all her salad wisdom. ❤️ thanks for being an OG influencer xoxo

You will love this healthy, hearty orzo salad recipe. It has so much texture, flavor and good for you ingredients

RECIPE
* 1 bunch dino kale washed and chopped
* 2 carrots ribboned or grated
* ½ head green cabbage shredded
* 1 watermellon radish chopped fine
* 10 cherry tomatoes halved
* 3 tbsp dill chopped
* 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
* 1 lemon juiced
* 1 tbsp Mandarin Orange Vinegar (You can use any citrus infused vinegar)
* ¼ tsp salt
* 1 black pepper to taste
* 8 oz orzo measure dry then cook according to package, drain, rinse and set aside
* 1 avocados quartered and sliced for serving
Crispy Garlic Chickpeas
* 15 oz can Chickpeas drained well
* 2 tsp Olive oil (I used Garlic Oil)
* 1 tsp garlic powder
* ¼ tsp salt
INSTRUCTIONS
Salad Base
* Add kale, cabbage, carrots and radishes to a large bowl.
* Add Oil, Lemon, vinegar, Salt and Pepper and mix well with hands. Massage the seasonings into the salad gently to coat well.
* add cooked orzo, dill, cherry tomatoes and a little more pepper and mix again
* Serve topped with Crispy Chickpeas and sliced avocado
Crispy Garlic Chickpeas
* Preheat oven to 400
* Drain chickpeas well and spread on sheet pan
* Drizzle with Oil, season with salt and garlic powder
* Mix well with hands
* Bake for 20-25 minutes until crispy, turning once halfway

KALE AND BEAN SALAD

Tell me in the comments: 
Do you use your (clean) bare hands to cook and mix?

This tasty vegan chopped kale and bean salad involves zero cooking and comes together in a flash. It’s tasty, hearty and nutritious and the super creamy yet dairy and oil-free blender dressing is amazing! This is the one that will turn you into a tahini addict and make you crave kale. Try it and thank me later.

RECIPE
serves 4
Ready in 10 mins
Ingredients:
*1 bunch kale, stems removed and shredded (about 3 cups)
*1 can black beans rinsed and drained
*4 Persian cucumbers or 1 English cucumber diced
*10 cherry tomatoes cut in quarters
*3 scallions white and green parts diced
*2 cups frozen corn (thawed)
*1 orange bell pepper diced
*2 avocados peeled and diced
1/4 cup tahini
2 limes juiced
1 tsp pure maple syrup
1/2 bunch cilantro leaves and stems
2 pinches salt
1/4 cup water

LOADED VEGAN CAESAR

If you have ever asked a vegan how they get protein this recipe is for you. It’s also for you if you ever said salad isn’t filling!

LOADED VEGAN CAESAR
Serves 6
Ready in 1 hour
Ingredients:

FOR CRISPY CHICKPEAS

Asparagus and Quinoa Salad

Do you agree? Tell me in the comments!!

This summery salad is busting out the flavor! The tangy lemon dijon dressing makes the asparagus taste so good and its perfect for making the quinoa wicked flavorful and lick your plate delicious. It’s balanced and filling but not heavy. Full of protein, fiber and hydration. You are gonna love this one!

Serves 5
Ready in 40 minutes
Ingredients:
For Dressing
1/4 cup olive oil
1 tbsp dijon mustard
1 tbsp maple syrup
1 lemon juiced
1/4 tsp salt
For Asparagus
1 bunch asparagus
Pinch salt
Few sprays oil
Fresh ground Black pepper
For Salad
8oz box red quinoa cooked and cooled
3 cups red cabbage
1 cup cherry tomatoes halved
3 cucumbers
15 oz can of cannelini beans
10 pitted calamata olives, sliced
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook quinoa according to box. Once cooked, spread out on a sheet pan to cool quickly while preparing other ingredients.
3. Pop asparagus onto a sheet pan, toss with oil, sat and pepper and bake for 10-12 minutes. Fatter asparagus will need up to 20 minutes until tender. Let cool then chop in thirds.
4. To make the dressing add olive oil, dijon mustard, maple syrup, lemon juice and salt to a blender. Puree until smooth
5. In a large bowl add shredded cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, cooled quinoa, cooled asparagus, cannelini beans, and olives. Pour dressing and toss well. 
6. Eat within 3 days for best quality

WILD RICE AND KALE SALAD

Do you follow the recipe?Tell me in the comments!

For today’s COOKING TIP MONDAY Let’s tackle the serious topic of RECIPES! Get empowered in the kitchen to cook without fear because you don’t need to follow a recipe precisely to rock a dish! Unless you accidentally add tablespoons of cayenne or cinnamon instead of cumin its always a good idea to alter the amounts to your own preference. Taste as you go and adjust if you like more salt, more sweet, more acid or spice. These recipes are pretty foundationally foolproof because I want you to be confident, comfortable and successful in the kitchen!

Now this hearty salad recipe. It has a zesty blender dressing that is full of flavor plus it’s healthy, hearty and nutritious. Go ahead and switch out the vinegar type, omit the olives, add roasted cauliflower, whatever is available or your heart desires and when in doubt just send me a message and I will guide you!

Happy Monday
❤️Sara

Ingredients:
Dressing
1 bell pepper oven roasted for 20 mins at 400 degrees 
1 clove garlic
3 tbsp olive oil
3tbsp red wine vinegar
1 tsp italian seasoning
1 tbsp agave or maple syrup
Pinch of salt and pepper
For Salad
8oz wild rice blend cooked according to package and cooled
4 cups kale massaged with 1 tbsp olive oil, pinch of salt and pepper until tender
2 Persian cucumbers
1 cup cherry tomatoes halved
10 olives sliced

1 15-oz can cannelini beans rinsed and drained

NSTRUCTIONS

 
cooking
* Cook wild rice according to box and cool

BROCCOLI RABE AND BEAN SALAD

Do you want your time in the kitchen to be easier and more efficient?

These are my favorite time savers. While your foods roast in the oven you can chop instead of stirring! And with a sharp knife it’s a breeze💨 My mini blender makes whisking unnecessary for emulsified dressings…And don’t feel bad about using canned beans, they rock! 

RECIPE:
Serves 5
Ready in 30 minutes
INGREDIENTS:
Roasted Veggies
1 bunch Broccoli Rabe chopped rustically in bite size pieces
4 baby bell peppers whole
1 tbsp olive oil
1 pinch salt
1 pinch black pepper
Dressing
3 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp maple syrup
3 tbsp white balsamic vinegar
½ tsp oregano flakes
1 pinch salt
1 clove garlic
2 ea baby bell peppers roasted with the roasted veggies
Salad
3 ea Persian cucumbers chopped
15 oz white beans
3 cups red cabbage
20 cherry tomatoes halved
10 calamata olives sliced
INSTRUCTIONS:
Roasted Veggies
Preheat oven to 400 degrees
On a sheet pan add the chopped broccoli rabe and whole baby bell peppers. Drizzle with oil and season with salt and pepper. Mix well.
Roast for 20 minutes. Flip once halfway.
Let cool. Once the peppers are cool enough to handle remove seeds and stems. Chop 4 for the salad and reserve 2 for the dressing.
Dressing
Add peppers to a blender with the oil, vinegar, maple syrup, salt, pepper, oregano and garlic. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Salad
To a large mixing bowl add the beans, cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, bell peppers, olives and broccoli rabe.
Pour the dressing over and toss well.
For best quality consume within 3-4 days.

SUMMER POTATO AND SMOKED GOUDA SALAD

Smash or pass? Tell us in the comments below

You won’t believe how tasty this summery vegan salad is. @goodplanetfoods (ad) you have done it again! These Smoked Gouda Wheels are a dream come true. The flavor and texture are just like real cheese and I am shocked that even my non-vegan kids devoured it. I kid you not, it’s like baked stuffed potatoes and potato salad had a baby and it’s next level delicious. Pick up some @goodplanetfoods Smoked Gouda Wheels at retailers nationwide and try it for yourself!

Recipe
Ready in  1 hour
Ingredients:
For Cooked Ingredients:
4 large Yukon gold potatoes cut in cubes
Oil for spraying
Pinch salt
1 cup walnut peices
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 tbsp maple syrup
1 tsp smoked paprika
1 head broccoli cut in florets
For Dressing
1 sprig parsley
1/4 cup olive oil
2 tbsp pure maple syrup
2 tbsp dijon mustard
1 pinch salt
2 lemons juiced
Black pepper optional to your liking
For Salad
2 cups frozen corn defrosted
2 cups cherry tomatoes cut in half
3 tbsp fresh parsley chopped
2 green onions white and green parts chopped small
8 oz GOODPLANet Foods Smoked Gouda Wheel large grate
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400
Boil potatoes for 10 minutes to soften before roasting. Then drain well.
Add potatoes to a sheet pan with several sprays olive oil and season with salt. Bake for 30 minutes turning every 10 minutes.
On another sheet pan add broccoli florets with a few sprays oil and pinch of salt. Cook for 20 minutes.
Make “bacon walnuts” by combining walnuts, soy sauce, smoked paprika and maple syrup.  Add to the broccoli sheet pan for the last 5 minutes of cooking
Make dressing by combining olive oil, parsley, lemon, dijon mustard, maple syrup and salt. Blend until smooth.
Once all the cooked elements are cool enough to not melt the cheese, add to a large bowl corn, tomatoes, roasted potatoes, roasted broccoli, “bacon” walnuts, parsley, smoked gouda, green onions and dressing. Toss well. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality.

RECIPE
Serves 6
Ready in 40 minutes
Ingredients:
8 oz dried farro
For Roasted Veg:
1/2 head cauliflower cut in florets
10 baby bell peppers halved
5 baby bell peppers whole
1 tsp olive oil
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/4 tsp salt
Few grinds fresh black pepper
For Dressing:
5 Roasted baby bell peppers
2 tbsp olive oil
2 tbsp red wine vinegar
1 tbsp maple syrup
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 tsp oregano
For Salad
1/2 head dinosaur kale shredded
20 cherry tomatoes halved
1/2 English cucumber cut in rounds
1/2 cup calamata and green olives pitted and sliced
1/2 cup artichoke hearts
Instructions:
1. Cook Farro according to directions then let cool
2. Preheat oven to 400
3. On a sheet pan spread cauliflower florets, halved baby bell peppers and whole baby bell peppers. Spray with olive oil, sprinkle with salt, garlic powder and pepper. Mix until well coated and bake for 20 minutes. Let cool.
4. Make the dressing in a blender with roasted whole baby peppers (remove stems) red wine vinegar, olive oil, maple syrup, salt and oregano. Blend until smooth and creamy.
5. In a large bowl, add kale, cooled farro, roasted baby bells (cut small) roasted cauliflower, tomatoes, cucumbers, artichoke hearts and olives. Pour dressing over the salad and mix well.

THE BEST LENTIL SOUP

What’s your favorite soup? Tell me in the comments!

Since it looks like the next few days are cold and chilly, it’s time to whip out the healthy comfort food. It’s such a great way to use up all the veggies that didn’t make it into salad this week! Try this easy lentil soup recipe. It’s tasty, nutritious and a wicked cheap way to feed the crew. Plus it’s filling without mega calories, it’s super cozy and a great way to get plant-based protein, iron and fiber. Eat it with some bread and butter, a grilled cheese, some rice or quinoa or  go old school with some crackers. 

Serves 8
Ready in 45 minutes
Ingredients:
1 pound lentils
10 cups water
1 tbsp olive oil
1 onion chopped
3 cloves garlic minced
3 carrots chopped
2 sweet potatoes peeled and diced
1 large can crushed tomatoes
1 tbsp italian seasoning
1 tsp salt plus more to taste
Black pepper to taste
Instructions:
1. Rinse the lentils in cold water to then add to a large pot with water and bring to a boil set a timer for 25 minutes
2. In a large sauté pan over medium heat add olive oil,onion and garlic and cook until fragrant about 5 minutes
3. Add carrots, butternut and sweet potatoes, season with salt and cook for 5 minutes stirring often.
4. Add contents of sauté pan to boiling lentils then cover to cook until timer set in step one goes off.
5. Check lentils, if soft, add canned tomatoes if not, wait another 5-10 minutes then add them
6. Add italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Taste for salt and adjust.  Simmer for 10 minutes. The soup is ready when all veggies are fork tender and the lentils are soft.
For an extra flavor boost add some fresh thyme leaves and a squeeze of lemon!

“TANDOORI” CAULIFLOWER

Can you believe this is vegan?

If you love yogurt, this post is for you! You must try my favorite vegan yogurt by @ForagerProject (AD) . Their plain cashew yogurt is perfect in savory recipes, you won’t even miss the dairy in creamy dressings, sauces and marinades. Look for it in grocers nationwide and rejoice in the dreamy texture. Thank me later!

RECIPE
Serves 4
Prep: 20 minutes
Cook: 30 minutes
Ingredients:
For Cauliflower:
2 large heads cauliflower cut in florets
8 oz Plain Forager Cashew Yogurt
3 cloves garlic chopped
2 inch nub ginger chopped
1 tbsp smoked paprika
½ tsp salt
½ tsp coriander
½ tsp garam masala
¼ tsp cayenne pepper
1 lemon juiced
Olive oil sprayed for cooking
For Pickles
1 large red onion sliced thin
2 jalapenos sliced thin
2 limes juiced
1 pinch salt
For Cucumber Yogurt Sauce
8 oz Plain Forager Cashew Yogurt
1 tsp garlic powder
1 lemon juiced
½ Englich cucumber chopped very small
1 tbsp maple syrup
2 tbsp cilantro chopped
2 tbsp fresh mint chopped
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400
In a large bowl combine yogurt, garlic, ginger, smoked paprika, cayenne, salt, coriander and garam masala. Mix well until combined. Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss until coated.
Spray a sheet pan with oil and place marinated cauliflower on the pan. Bake for 30 minutes turning once every 10 minutes
Make pickes. In a medium bowl add onions, jalapeños, lime juice and salt. Mix weel the. Set aside.
Make cucumber yogurt sauce in a medium bowl by combining cucumbers, lemon, salt, garlic powder, mint, cilantro and yogurt. Mix until well combined.
To serve: pour 1 cup cucumber yogurt sauce on a plate. Top with cauliflower, then garnish with pickles and extra cilantro.
Reserve the extra cucumber yogurt sauce for dipping or pita chips.

6 INGREDIENT VEGAN PASTA
RECIPE
Ready in 15 mins
Serves 5-6
Ingredients:
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* 2 tbsp vegan butter optional
* 5 cloves garlic chopped
* 3 tsp tomato paste
* 1 salt and pepper to taste
* 3 tbsp nutritional yeast for sauce and garnish
* 2 cups baby spinach
* 15 oz Unsweetened Light Coconut Milk canned
* 1/2 tsp crushed red pepper optional
* 16 oz pasta of choice preferably with lines
* 3 tbsp Hemp seed for garnish optional
* Instructions:
* Roast your veggies of choice on a sheet pan for 20 mins at 400 degrees
* Then put a large pot of water on to boil to cook the pasta on the back burner.
* In a deep sauté pan over medium heat, add olive oil and garlic and cook until the garlic is fragrant and golden, stirring often for about 3-4 minutes. Add crushed red pepper if desired and cook for 30 seconds.
* Next add the tomato paste and caramelize for 2-3 minutes
* Add coconut milk and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium low until the pasta is cooked. Season the sauce with salt, pepper and nutritional yeast.
* Once the pasta is cooked, drain it , add a pat of vegan butter if desired then add baby spinach and toss with sauce and pasta until all is wilted and well combined. Taste and adjust salt and pepper to your liking.
* Serve with salad or veggies of choice, top with some more nutritional yeast, pepper and crushed pepper. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality.

PRETTY BEET & POTATO SALAD

Do you peel potatoes?

You won’t catch me doing that unless the potatoes are on their way out! And another thing you won’t catch me doing is making a boring potato salad! 

RECIPE
serves 5
Ready in 30 minutes
Ingredients:
* 1 head cauliflower cut in florets, then oven roasted
* 3 roasted red peppers jarred, chopped
* 4 beets boiled then peeled and chopped
* 15 oz chickpeas drained
* 1 red onion small onion sliced thin
* 1 pound baby potatoes boiled, then chopped
* 2 tbsp dill chopped
* 3 tbsp pepitas unsalted
* 2 limes juiced
* 4 tbsp olive oil extra virgin
* 1 tbsp white balsamic vinegar
* 1 tbsp pure maple syrup
* 1 salt and pepper to taste
* 1 tsp olive oil
* 10 pitted calamata olives sliced
* Lime zest optional
INSTRUCTIONS
* Preheat the oven to 400. Place cauliflower florets on a sheet pan and season with a pinch of salt and a tsp of olive oil. Toss well then bake in the oven for 30 minutes turning once halfway. Once cooked let cook until salad assembly step.
* In a medium sized saucepan place the unpeeled beets and whole baby potatoes in enough water to cover them plus 2-3 inches. Bring to a rolling boil and cook until fork tender. About 30 minutes. Once they are tender run them under cold water. The beets are very easy to peel once cooked by sliding your thumbs along the skin. Once peeled chop them in thin half moons. Cut the potatoes in bite sized pieces. Don’t worry about the potatoes getting stained by the beets. The dish is pink!
* In a large bowl layer the cooled beets and potatoes, the cooled roasted cauliflower, drained chickpeas, sliced onion, olives and chopped roasted peppers. Dress them by adding the olive oil, squeezing the limes, add the white balsamic, maple syrup, chopped dill, lime zest, salt and pepper. Toss until the flavors are well incorporated.
* Transfer to a serving platter or containers for meal prep. Eat within 4 days for the best quality.

Dill “Pickle” Potato Salad

Do you agree that old school potato salad is wicked boring? Yay or Nay?

BBQs are all about the side dishes. Bring this to your next one and blow everyone’s mind. It’s tangy, a little sweet, super herby and fresh. Now THIS is potato salad. Give it a try. Bonus is it’s a really easy cook🤙

For salad
2 pounds yukon gold potatoes 
1 large english cucumber sliced thin
1/2 or 1/4 red onion sliced thin according to your preference
1/2 lemon squeezed
For Dressing
2 tbsp white vinegar
2 tbsp dijon mustard
2 tbsp maple syrup
2 tbsp olive oil
1/4 tsp salt
2 tbsp chopped dill
2 green onions chopped white and green parts
Instructions:
1. First boil the potatoes. Add them to a pot whole, with skins on and boil until fork tender. This can take 15-30 minutes depending on how large the potatoes are. Pro tip: put the larger potatoes on the bottom and small on top then cover with water and boil. Once tender, drain water and let cool until ok to touch without getting burned. Cut in bite sized pieces. Reserve until last step.
2. Make the dressing by combining vinegar, dijon mustard, maple syrup, olive oil, dill, salt and green onions in a small bowl and whisking.
3. To a large bowl add the cucumbers and red onion. Add 1/2 the dressing and toss. Then add the potatoes, the rest of the dressing, a pinch of salt and black pepper and half a lemon juiced. Toss until well combined.
4. This salad is good for up to 4 days as the cucumbers and onions get more pickled with time!

BROCCOLI AND LENTIL SALAD
RECIPE INGREDIENTS
Serves 5
FOR SALAD
2 cups kale chopped
2-3 drops olive oil
4 Roasted baby bell peppers deseeded and chopped
1 cup dried Black Lentils
1 bunch Parsley
1/2 cup julienned Sundried tomatoes
1/4 cup julienned Dried apricots
1/4 cup pepitas
ROASTED BROCCOLI
2 heads broccoli cut in florets
Drizzle olive oil
Salt and pepper
QUICK PICKLED RED ONIONS
1 small Red onion sliced 
1 tbsp maple syrup
2 tbsp white balsamic vinegar
Pinch salt and pepper
DRESSING
1/4 cup tahini
1/2 cup water
2 roasted peppers
1/2 cup parsley
1 clove garlic
1 lemon juiced
1 pinch salt
INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Place broccoli, olive oil, salt and pepper on a sheet pan and roast for 20 minutes. Let cool
3. On an oven safe pan (you can put with the broccoli if you want) roast the whole baby bell peppers for 20 minutes. Once soft, let cool enough to handle and then seed and stem. Then chop small
4. Boil the lentils in enough water to cover plus 2 inches until soft. About 20 minutes. Drain and rinse under cool water.
5. Make quick pickled red onions The longer they sit, the more delicious
6. Make dressing by combining ingredients in a blender. Puree until smooth. If it is too thick add 1/4 cup water to make it pourable.
7. In a bowl, add kale and a few drops olive oil and massage for a minute to soften the leaves. Then add the other ingredients. Toss well then top with apricots and pipitas

If you are swimming in zuchinni use that instead of the broccolini, or in addition to because there’s no such thing as too many veggies. Bread and Circus (now it’s Whole Foods) thanks for the great cooking lessons and memories with our motley little deli crew: Marie, TR, Jake, Marty, Sheila and the rest: big love to you freaks wherever you are. 

Serves 5
Ready in 30 minutes
Ingredients:
5 cloves garlic minced
2 compare tomatoes chopped small
3 tbsp olive oil
1 generous pinch crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
1 cup frozen peas
1 bunch broccolini cut in bite sized pieces
1 pint multicolor cherry tomatoes cut in half or quarters
2 tbsp vegan butter
2 lemons juiced
1/2 tsp salt divided into pinches to season as you are cooking
Handful chopped basil
Instructions:
1. Put on water to boil on back burner. Cook Capellini according to package, then drain and rinse with cold water, then toss with a little olive oil to prevent sticking and reserve until last step

3. Add broccolini and a pinch of salt and cook stirring occasionally for 3-4 minutes.
4. Add peas and another pinch of salt and cook for 3-4 minutes
5. Add chopped compari tomatoes, season with a pinch of salt and a few grinds black pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes stirring occasionally until tomatoes are releasing their juices. 
6. Add cooked pasta, vegan butter, chopped cherry tomatoes, lemon juice, and salt and pepper. Turn off heat and toss well. Add basil last and toss.
7. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality. Hot or cold.

Italian Vegan Pasta Salad

Do you love a cheesy pasta salad?

@goodplanetfoods has done it again. (AD) They have reinvented a classic and made it vegan and it is glorious. Shaky Parmesan Cheese was an essential for pastas and pasta salads before going vegan and now I can have it again. I am overjoyed! Look for this beloved classic in stores nationwide like @Publix or check their website for a location near you! This 100% plant based “cheese” is gluten-free, nut-free and soy-free and it’s 100% delicious.

Serves 6
Ready in 30 minutes
1 pound pasta
1 15-oz can chickpeas drained
1/4 cup GoodPLANet Foods Parmesan
For cooked veg
1/2 zucchini cut in half moons
1 summer squash cut in rounds
2 cloves garlic chopped
2 tbsp olive oil
1 pinch red pepper flakes
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper
3 baby bell peppers diced
For Salad:
2 compari tomatoes diced
10 pitted calamari olives chopped
10 manzanilla olives chopped
1/4 cup chopped herbs (mix of parsley, dill and mint)
For Dressing:
5 tbsp olive oil
1.5 lemons juiced
1/2 tsp salt
1 clove garlic
2 tbsp maple syrup
Ground black pepper
1/2 cup herbs (mix of parsley, dill and mint)
Instructions:
1. Put on water to boil for pasta and cook according to the box. Once cooked, rinse with cold water and set aside until other elements are ready
2. In a large sauce pan, over medium heat, add the olive oil and warm. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant. Add zucchini, summer squash and peppers and cook for 7 minutes stirring occasionally until veggies are tender. Let cool.

THE BEST AVO TIPS

Did any of these surprise you?
Tell me below⬇️

If you want to be an avocado queen follow these expert tips!

🥑 Get that hard bellybutton thing away because if it falls in the guac you can break a tooth. It happens😱

🥑Always cut on a board. I know people who have cut their palm. Just don’t.🙏

🥑 Twist it open and pop out the pit. Knives in the air are a big no-no🤙

🥑Use a teaspoon to remove the meat. This is the neatest way. Or slide your thumb in between the skin and fruit and do it that way. If it doesn’t come out easy, it’s not ready.😃

🥑Slice your avo with a hinge on one side. That way you won’t lose slices when you bite into your sandwich. That’s the worst!😢

🥑When you make guacamole, always make a barrier with plastic wrap to preserve the freshness. A lid doesn’t work the same way because it traps air inside the container which will turn the avo brown real fast!😭

GREEK SALAD WITH CREAMY VEGAN DRESSING 

Do you love epic salad dressings? 

Then you need to try this Creamy Vegan Greek Dressing! @foragerproject plain drinkable vegan yogurt (Ad) is the perfect base for this epic lemony and herby dressing. It’s dairy-free, vegan and gluten free and has the perfect amount of tang! All the gorgeous fresh peppers, tomatoes and cukes are the perfect vehicle to deliver this delicious dressing. Whenever I make a savory and creamy recipe, I reach for my favorite plant-based yogurts from @foragerproject They have the perfect texture and flavor for everything I want to make. Look for them in stores nationwide! 

Recipe
Serves 6 
Ready in 20 minutes 
Vegan, Dairy Free, Gluten Free, No-cook Recipe 
Ingredients: 
For salad 
2 cups arugula 
2 cups red cabbage shredded 
12 calamata olives 
2 cups cherry tomatoes halved 
4 persian cucumbers chopped 
½ red onion sliced thin 
15 ounce can chickpeas drained 
6 multicolor baby bell peppers chopped 
1 green pepper chopped 
For Dressing: 
1 cup Forager Project Plain drinkable yogurt 
2 tablespoons olive oil 
1.5 lemons juiced 
10 mint leaves 
1 sprig fresh oregano 
2 tablespoon pure maple syrup 
½ teaspoon salt 
Black pepper to your taste 
1 clove garlic 
1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar 
Instructions: 
1. Add arugula, cabbage, peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes, chickpeas, and onion to a large bowl. 
2. Make dressing in a blender by combining plain drinkable yogurt, olive oil, lemon, maple syrup, salt, garlic, vinegar, mint, oregano and black pepper. Blend until smooth. 3. Dress salad by pouring the blended creamy dressing over the salad and tossing until well combined. Serve immediately.
Tips: 
Arugula will break down with the dressing over time so I recommend dressing right before serving. 
If you want to make ahead of time swap in kale for arugula as kale will be good dressed for up to 3 days. 
Or if you prefer leave out the greens completely. The cucumbers, chickpeas and onions are divine after marinating overnight. This will be good to eat for 3-4 days.

LOADED VEGAN POKE BOWL
Serves 2
Ingredients:
1/4 head red cabbage shredded
1/4 cup green cabbage shredded
10 dried shiitake mushrooms rehydrated
1 large beet peeled and cubed
1 block tofu sliced in cutlets
spray of oil
1/2 red bell pepper sliced
1 Persian cucumber sliced
1 avocado sliced
2 tsp seaweed gomasio for sprinkling
1 stalk Green onion chopped
2 cups cooked brown rice

DRESSING:
2 tbsp sesame oil

1 tbsp pure maple syrup
1 tsp seaweed gomasio
Instructions:
1. Cook brown rice according to package
2. Cook tofu on a sheet pan at 400 degrees for 30 minutes with a few sprays of oil to prevent sticking.
3. Rehydrate mushrooms with hit water
4. Boil beets whole until soft about 20 minutes. Let cool then peel and slice
5. Make dressing by combining sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, maple strup and gomasio
6. Arrange ingredients attractively and drizzle with dressing

Asparagus and Quinoa Salad

Tell me about your happy place! Have you found a way to harness it for a job?

You need to try this super satisfying summer salad. It’s easy to make, tastes amazing and it’s wicked good for you too!

Serves 5
Ready in 40 minutes
Ingredients:
For Dressing
1/4 cup olive oil
1 tbsp dijon mustard
1 tbsp maple syrup
1 lemon juiced
1/4 tsp salt
For Asparagus
1 bunch asparagus
Pinch salt
Few sprays oil
Fresh ground Black pepper
For Salad
8oz box red quinoa cooked and cooled
3 cups red cabbage
1 cup cherry tomatoes halved
3 cucumbers
15 oz can of cannelini beans
10 pitted calamata olives, sliced
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook quinoa according to box. Once cooked, spread out on a sheet pan to cool quickly while preparing other ingredients.
3. Pop asparagus onto a sheet pan, toss with oil, sat and pepper and bake for 10-12 minutes. Fatter asparagus will need up to 20 minutes until tender. Let cool then chop in thirds.
4. To make the dressing add olive oil, dijon mustard, maple syrup, lemon juice and salt to a blender. Puree until smooth
5. In a large bowl add shredded cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, cooled quinoa, cooled asparagus, cannelini beans, and olives. Pour dressing and toss well. 
6. Eat within 3 days for best quality

Easy Vegan Kale Caesar

Smash or Pass?

If you never had a kale caesar, this is your sign to try one. In my humble opinion this recipe is perfection. Forget the raw egg/anchovy and oil concoction theres a new kid in town thats healthier and way more delicious. Bonus, a kale caesar keeps for 3-4 days even dressed unlike romaine who wilts in an hour🤣 
Ingredients:
For Salad
1 bunch kale stemmed and chopped about 5 cups
2 cups red cabbage shredded
For Chickpeas
15 oz can chickpeas drained
1 pinch salt
1/4 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp smoked paprika
Olive Oil for spraying
For Croutons
2 cups bread cut in cubes
Olive oil for spraying
1 pinch salt
1/4 tsp garlic powder
For Dressing
2 small cloves garlic
2 pinches salt
1 cup raw cashews
1 cup water
1 lemon squeezed
2 tsp dijon mustard
2 tbsp hemp hearts
2 tbsp nutritional yeast
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Make the chickpeas by combining them with a couple sprays of oil, salt, garlic powder and smoked paprika. Mix well and put on a sheet pan and bake 20 minutes to get crispy
3. Make the croutons by combining cubed bread, a few sprays of olive oil, salt and garlic powder. Bake for 10-12 minutes until crispy
4. Make the dressing by combining garlic, cashews, water, salt, pepper, lemon, dijon mustard, hemp seeds and nutritional yeast in a blender. Blend until smooth. 
5. In a large bowl add the kale, cabbage, crispy chickpeas, croutons and half of the dressing. Toss well and eat within 3-4 days for best quality. Save the other half of the dressing for your next salad.

THE BEST LENTIL SOUP

What is your favorite soup? Tell me in the comments!

Soup is such a great way to use up all the veggies that didn’t make it into salad this week! Try this easy lentil soup recipe. It’s tasty, nutritious and a wicked cheap way to feed the crew. Plus it’s filling without mega calories, it’s super cozy and a great way to get plant-based protein, iron and fiber. Eat it with some bread and butter, a grilled cheese, some rice or quinoa or go old school with some crackers. 

Serves 8
Ready in 45 minutes
Ingredients:
1 pound lentils
10 cups water
1 tbsp olive oil
1 onion chopped
3 cloves garlic minced
3 carrots chopped
2 sweet potatoes peeled and diced
1 large can crushed tomatoes
1 tbsp italian seasoning
1 tsp salt plus more to taste
Black pepper to taste
Instructions:
1. Rinse the lentils in cold water to then add to a large pot with water and bring to a boil set a timer for 25 minutes
2. In a large sauté pan over medium heat add olive oil,onion and garlic and cook until fragrant about 5 minutes
3. Add carrots, butternut and sweet potatoes, season with salt and cook for 5 minutes stirring often.
4. Add contents of sauté pan to boiling lentils then cover to cook until timer set in step one goes off.
5. Check lentils, if soft, add canned tomatoes if not, wait another 5-10 minutes then add them
6. Add italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Taste for salt and adjust.  Simmer for 10 minutes. The soup is ready when all veggies are fork tender and the lentils are soft.

LOADED VEGAN CAESAR

Smash or Pass? Tell me in the comments!

Recipe
Serves 6
Ready in 1 hour
Ingredients:
2 cups cooked brown rice cooled
2 cups shredded Cole slaw mix (red  and green cabbage, carrots)
2 romaine hearts cut in bite sized pieces
FOR CRISPY CHICKPEAS
1 15 oz can chickpeas drained
1 tsp olive oil
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp smoked paprika
FOR CAJUN TOFU
1 block extra firm tofu drained well
3 tsp cajun spice
A few sprays of olive oil
FOR DRESSING:
1 cup raw cashew pieces
6 each Brazil nuts
1 lemon juiced
1/4 tsp vegan Worcestershire
1 pinch seaweed flakes
2 tbsp olive oil
4 tbsp water
1/2 tsp salt
1 clove garlic
Pinch of Black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook Brown Rice according to package and let cool. I like to cook large batches in the beginning of the week and keep it refrigerated for recipes like this one and sides for warm bowls. You can also use frozen prepared brown rice. Just be sure to let it cool before combining with the lettuce.
3. On a large sheet pan MAKE CRISPY CHICKPEAS by combining chickpeas with oil, salt, garlic powder and smoked paprika and spread in a single layer.
4. MAKE THE CAJUN TOFU by cutting the block of tofu in 3 widthwise. Score the tofu with a crosshatch pattern and rub each “cutlet” with 1 tsp of cajun spice. Place on the other side of the same sheet pan as the chickpeas and spray with oil. 
5. Bake the chickpeas and tofu for 35 minutes, turning once halfway. Let cool and chop the tofu in cubes.
6. MAKE THE DRESSING: combine soaked and drained cashews, Brazil nuts, lemon, vegan Worcestershire, seaweed flakes, olive oil, water, salt, garlic and pepper in a blender and puree until smooth and creamy. If the dressing is too thick (because lemons vary) add an extra tablespoon of water to loosen it up and blend again.
7. In a large bowl, add cooled brown rice, romaine, Cole slaw mix, crispy chickpeas, cajun tofu and dressing.
8. Eat within 2 days. For a longer shelf life of 4 days, substitute chopped kale for the romaine. This is an excellent salad for food prep if you keep the dressing separate and dress it right before eating. It also makes a KILLER “chicken” Caesar wrap

CRISPY CHICKPEA CHOPPED SALAD 

Do you think salad can be a meal? Tell me in the comments!

This one has everything you need: crispy chickpeas, creamy lemon-tahini dressing,  raw and roasted veggies and fresh herbs. It is the definition of a meal salad. Filling, nutritious and delicious!

Recipe:
Serves 4
Ready in 45 minutes
For Crispy Chickpeas
* 2 15 oz cans chickpeas drained
* 1 tbsp olive oil
* 1 tsp ground cumin
* 1 tbsp ground coriander
* 1 tsp garlic powder
* 1 pinch salt
For Salad
* 3 cups escarole or any hardy lettuce, chopped
* 1 roasted orange bell pepper roasted and chopped
* 2 cups green cabbage shredded
* 2 cups red cabbage shredded
* ¼ cup parsley chopped
* ¼ red onion sliced
For Dressing
* ½ cup sesame tahini
* ¼ cup water
* 2 lemons juiced
* ½ tsp garlic powder
* ¼ tsp salt
* 1 tsp maple syrup
INSTRUCTIONs
For Crispy Chickpeas
* Preheat oven to 400
* Toss the drained chickpeas with the olive oil, cumin, coriander, garlic powder and salt. Place them on a sheet pan in a single layer, along with the bell pepper cut in quarters. Bake for 30 minutes. Set aside to cool.
For Salad
* Chop the escarole, cabbage, onion and parsley uniformly for the salad and put them into a large bowl. Once the roasted bell peppers are cool, seed and chop and add to the salad bowl.
For Dressing
* Make the dressing by combining tahini, water, lemon, garlic powder, salt and maple syrup and mixing until smooth and creamy
* Assembly
Toss the salad with half of the dressing. Top with the crispy chickpeas and the remaining creamy lemon tahini dressing.

HERBED VEGGIE PASTA SALAD
RECIPE:

Ingredients:

Pinch salt

For Roasted Veg:

Do you eat cabbage?

Here’s 3 reasons you need cabbage in your life:

1. It’s the ideal salad ingredient. It holds up well to being dressed in advance, it’s cheap and has a super mild flavor which makes it versatile af
2. It’s wicked good for you. It has fiber and vitamins plus some say it helps prevent ulcers. This life can be stressful af, cabbage is my insurance policy🤣
3. Cabbage is pretty! Purple food? Hello. Also it lasts FOREVER. Buy a head of cabbage and literally eat it for 3 weeks and its still good. Other veggies not so much. Hello spinach and spring mix with your two day shelf life. What the.

Buy cabbage and chop it yourself. Few things in life are so simply satisfying as butchering a head of cabbage with a sharp knife. Try my technique and see❤️

EASY AIR-FRIED 
VEGAN EGGROLLS

How many could you eat?

RECIPE
Makes 12 eggrolls
Ingredients:
* 12 vegan eggroll wrappers
* 1 block extra firm tofu drained, pressed and cubed
* 4 cups pre-cut coleslaw mix (green cabbage, carrots and purple cabbage)
* 2 cloves garlic minced
* 1 tbsp dark soy sauce
* 2 tbsp light sodium soy sauce
* 1 tbsp toasted sesame oil
* oil of choice for spraying
* 2 tsp ginger minced
INSTRUCTIONS
* In a large and deep skillet, heat the sesame oil over medium heat and then add the crumbled tofu. Set the timer for 5 minutes and do not move the tofu until it sounds.
* Stir the tofu and then make space in the center of the pan to add the garlic and ginger. Cook without stirring for 2-3 minutes then mix into the tofu mixture.
* Add the dark soy sauce and cook for 2-3 minutes stirring to distribute throughout the tofu mixture. It will resemble ground pork.
* Add the shredded coleslaw veggies and the light soy sauce. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring often. Then turn off the heat and let the mix cool.
* Set up a station to make the eggrolls with the wrappers and a small bowl of water to dip your fingers in to seal the little eggroll packages.
* One at a time, take a wrapper and put about 3 tbsp of the filling in the middle and spread it horizontally in a line. Fold the sides up around the mixture slightly and then roll the side closest to you around the mixture. It is very similar to rolling a burrito. Use your finger to wet the edge to make a seal once you have made your little package. Do this with all 12.
* Once finished, spray the air fryer basket with oil and place the eggrolls inside. Depending on the size of your air-fryer, this may take two rounds of cooking. Do not let the eggrolls touch one another. 
* Spray the tops with oil and then air fry at 400 degrees for 5 minutes. Carefully flip them with tongs and air-fry for an additional 5 minutes.
* Serve with dipping sauce of choice. I like Thai sweet chili sauce, hoisin or soy sauce.

Do you eat pasta? Tell me in the comments!

A tasty nutritious dinner that can be on your plate in less than 30
Minutes? Sign me up! This easy pasta recipe is chock full of beans and greens. That’s my favorite combo! This meal has about 24g of protein and less than 550 calories per serving. Pasta dinners are what keep us eating good during the busy Fall and Winter months. We sneak in lots or veggies and everyone is happy.

BEAN AND BROCCOLI RABE PASTA

RECIPE
Ready in 20 mins
Serves:5
Ingrdients: 1 pound pasta
1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
1/4 red onion cut in strips
1 bunch broccoli rabe washed and rustic chop
4 cloves garlic minced
3 yellow baby bell peppers chopped
1 cup frozen corn
1 15-oz can white beans drained, salt and pepper to taste
3 tablespoons water
2 tbsp vegan butter optional
red pepper flakes 
vegan parmesan or nutritional yeast for garnish
Instructions:
1. Put on water to boil and cook pasta simultaneously while cooking “sauce”
2. In a deep sauté pan, Heat oil on medium and cook garlic and onions until toasty and fragrant about 5 mins stirring often
3. Add bell peppers and cook for 3-4 mins
4. Add broccoli rabe, beans, and corn, season with a sprinkle of salt and pepper, add water and cover for 3-4 minutes
5. Toss cooked pasta with vegan butter, the veggies and taste for salt. Adjust to your preferences and garnish with crushed red pepper, vegan parm or nooch

MEDITERRANEAN BEAN SALAD
Serves 4-5
Ready in 10 minutes
Ingredients:
2 cups cherry tomatoes cut in half
1 large garden cucumber cut in half moons
1 stalk celery chopped small
Large handful fresh basil chopped
15 oz can chickpeas drained
15 oz can cannelini beans drained
10 pitted calamata olives sliced
10 stuffed manzanilla olives sliced
2 tablespoons olive oil
2-3 cloves garlic minced
1/2 tsp salt
1 pinch crushed red pepper
Black pepper to taste
1 baguette sliced
1 lemon juiced
Instructions:
1. In a large bowl add tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, celery and chickpeas, olives, olive oil, lemon, salt, garlic, crushed red pepper and basil. Mix well.
2. Serve with sliced baguette or over a bed of salad greens. 
3. Enjoy within 2-3 days

PEANUT SAUCE POWER SLAW

Didn’t cole slaw need a makeover?

This slaw has it all! Crunchy veggies, zippy fresh herbs, sweet and tangy peanut sauce with a little spice and wicked filling edamame. Bring it to the partay and thank me later🌈

Recipe
About 400 calories, 20G Protein
Serves 5 
Ready in 20 minutes
Ingredients:
* 3 cups edamame shelled and defrosted
* 1 cup Red cabbage
* 2 cups Green cabbage shredded
* 2 Carrots peeled and grated
* 2 tbsp Mint chopped
* 4 tbsp Cilantro chopped
* 2 Persian Cucumber cut in half moons
* 1 cup Peanuts roasted and unsalted
* 2 tbsp Rice vinegar
* 2 tbsp Peanut butter heaping
* 1 tsp Sriracha
* 1 tbsp Maple syrup
* 1 Lime juiced
* 2 tbsp Sweet chili sauce
* 3 baby bell peppers multicolored. Seeded and sliced.
* 2 scallions white and green parts sliced
* 1 mango peeled and sliced
* 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce
* INSTRUCTIONS
* First, defrost the edamame by leaving overnight in the refrigerator or by running under water while preparing the vegetables. Drain well before adding to salad
* Make the dressing by adding to a bowl:peanut butter, sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, lime juice, sriracha and maple syrup. Mix until well combined.
* Add cabbage, carrots, cucumbers, peppers, edamame, peanuts, mint and cilantro to a bowl. For the dressing and mix well.

PUTTANESCA PASTA SALAD

Do you like easy recipes?
I got you covered❤️

This Italian inspired pasta salad is full of all the Mediterranean flavor bomb goodies: olives, capers, artichoke hearts, tomatoes and fresh herbs all drizzled in an easy tomato-balsamic vinaigrette. This one is wicked🔥.

RECIPE
Ready in 15 minutes
Serves 6
Ingredients
1 pound pasta cooked and cooled
2 tbsp capers
10 pitted manzanilla olives chopped
10 pitted calamata olives chopped
20 cherry tomatoes chopped
2 tbsp chopped basil
3 tbsp chopped parsley
6 artichoke hearts cut in slices
Dressing:
1 tbsp tomato paste
3 tbsp white balsamic
3 tbsp olive oil
1 pinch salt
Black pepper
Instructions:
1. Cook pasta according to directions, rinse and drain
2. In a large bowl add pasta, tomatoes, olives, artichokes, herbs and capers. Make sure to season your tomatoes with salt and pepper to make their flavor really pop!
3. Make the dressing by combining tomato paste, oil and vinegar, salt and pepper and whisk until smooth
4. Add dressing to the bowl with salad and pasta ingredients and mix well.
5. Eat within 4 days

👉POMODORO PASTA
with garlic, fresh tomatoes and basil from the garden tossed with spaghetti..

RECIPE
Serves:5
Prep: 5 mins
Cook: 15 mins
Ingredients: 
1 cup cherry tomatoes chopped
3-4 romas or other tomatoes chopped
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
4 garlic cloves minced
salt and pepper to taste
6 basil leaves chopped
crushed red pepper to taste
Vegan butter optional
How to:
1. Put on water to boil for pasta and cook in the back ground

4. Toss the cooked pasta in sauce and optional vegan butter then garnish with basil and red pepper flakes. 
5. Serve with salad!

Episode 3
LEMON CAPELLINI

Do you love tomatoes?!

Here’s how you start using all those garden tomatoes. If you are swimming in zuchinni use that instead of the broccolini, or in addition to because there’s no such thing as too many veggies. This one is just as great cold as leftovers as when you finish cooking it and it’s piping hot. 

Recipe
Serves 5
Ready in 30 minutes
Ingredients:
5 cloves garlic minced
2 compare tomatoes chopped small
3 tbsp olive oil
1 generous pinch crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
1 cup frozen peas
1 bunch broccolini cut in bite sized pieces
1 pint multicolor cherry tomatoes cut in half or quarters
2 tbsp vegan butter
2 lemons juiced
1/2 tsp salt divided into pinches to season as you are cooking
Handful chopped basil
Instructions:
1. Put on water to boil on back burner. Cook Capellini according to package, then drain and rinse with cold water, then toss with a little olive oil to prevent sticking and reserve until last step
2. In a large, deep sauce pan over medium heat, add olive oil and wait 1 minute before adding garlic and chili flakes. Cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
3. Add broccolini and a pinch of salt and cook stirring occasionally for 3-4 minutes.
4. Add peas and another pinch of salt and cook for 2-3 minutes
5. Add chopped compare tomatoes, season with a pinch of salt and a few grinds black pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes stirring occasionally until tomatoes are releasing their juices. 
6. Add cooked pasta, vegan butter, chopped cherry tomatoes, lemon juice, and salt and pepper. Turn off heat and toss well. Add basil last and toss.
7. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality. Hot or cold.

NEW RECIPE 
for soup week
“Sausage” and Kale Soup

Do you make homemade soup? Did you know it’s wicked easy? 
It’s time to try it, you can be a soup master too!

Recipe
Ready in about 45 minutes
Serves 6
Ingredients:
2 tbsp olive oil
1 block tempeh crumbled into tiny pieces
4 garlic cloves minced
1/2 onion chopped
3 carrots peeled and diced
3 celery stalks chopped small
1 fennel bulb diced
1 15-oz can chickpeas
1 15-oz can crushed tomatoes
4 fresh tomatoes chopped 
10 cups water
2 tbsp Italian seasoning
2 tsp salt plus more to taste
2 tablespoons smoked paprika
2 tbsp nooch
Black pepper to taste
1 bunch kale stemmed and chopped
Instructions:
1. In a large soup pot, heat oil over medium heat and add tempeh and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes until garlic is very fragrant.
2. Add 1 tsp salt and smoked paprika and cook for 2 minutes then add onions and fennel and cook for 5 minutes stirring often to avoid sticking
3. Add celery and carrots and tomatoes, 1 tsp salt and pepper to your liking and cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes are releasing their juices.
4. Add italian seasoning, water, chickpeas and canned tomatoes and bring to a boil. 
5. Simmer for 20 minutes then add kale and nutritional yeast.
6. Serve with nutritional yeast and black pepper garnish.
7. Always let soup cool to room temp before covering and storing in the fridge. Soup is good for 5 days for best quality or frozen for up to 3 months.

Spinach and Artichoke dip

Are you here for the Sports or the snacks?

Don’t think going plant-based means missing out or feeling deprived. You and all your party people are going to love this Spinach and Artichoke dip. Thanks to @goodplanetfoods (AD)nobody will even know it’s plant-based, it’s that good! The Smoked Gouda Wheels have such delicious and distinct flavor and the Mozzarella shreds are such a creamy melt. It’s insane! These plant-based cheeses are sold in grocers nationwide, check their websites’s location finder for a store near you.

Serves 6-8
1 loaf crusty bread toasted and sliced
14 oz baby spinach, blanched, squeezed of excess water and chopped
1 cup artichoke hearts chopped small
1 block silken tofu
1 clove garlic
1/2 lemon squeezed
1 tbsp white miso paste
1 tsp salt
2 tbsp water
Pepper
1/2 block Vegan smoked gouda wheel @goodplanetfoods 
1/2 bag vegan mozzarella shreds @goodplanetfoods 
Black pepper to taste
Instructions:
1. Blanch spinach by popping in boiling water for 10 seconds until wilted and bright green. Shock with cold water or ice bath to stop cooking process. Squeeze out excess moisture and chop in small pieces.
2. Preheat oven to 375
3. To a blender add silken tofu, miso, lemon, salt, water, and garlic and blend until smooth and creamy.
4. In an oven safe baking pan layer the spinach, artichoke hearts, creamy tofu mixture, vegan smoked gouda and mozzarella. Top with fresh ground black pepper. Mix well and use a silicon spatula to spread the mix out to make a smooth surface. Cover with tin foil and bake for 15 minutes. 
5. Remove foil and bake for 5 additional minutes to brown the top.
6. Let cool 5 minutes and devour.

Vegan Pasta e Fagioli

Tell me your favorite season in the comments!!⬇️

It’s officially Fall 🍂 The unofficial season of nostalgia and core memory retrieval! I think there’s something in the Fall air that brings those magical moments back to us. I always feel closer to my loved ones who have passed during this season, and I love that.
You are going to love this Italian inspired recipe. It is full of flavorful veggies, rich broth, beans and some wicked vibes. 

RECIPE
Ready in 40 minutes
Serves 6
Ingredients:
2 tbsp olive oil
1 onion small dice
4 cloves garlic minced
3 celery stalks small dice (about a cup)
4 rainbow carrots peeled and cut in rounds (or regular carrots)
2 cups butternut squash peeled and cut in small cubes
2 15 oz cans cannelloni beans drained
3 tbsp tomato paste
1 tsp salt
1tsp smoked paprika
1 tbsp dry Italian seasoning
1 tsp fresh thyme leaves
6 cups water
Instructions:
1. In a large pot over medium heat add olive oil and sauté onion and garlic for 5 minutes until fragrant
2. Add celery, carrots and squash and sauté for 5 minutes stirring occasionally.
3. Add tomato paste and cook for 5 minutes stirring often until tomato paste deepens in color
4. Add canned tomatoes, beans, water, Italian seasoning, smoked paprika, salt and then bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes
5. Remove 2 cups of the chunky soup and add to the blender and puree until smooth. Add it back into the soup to thicken it. Finish with fresh thyme and black pepper. Taste for salt and adjust to your liking.
6. Cook ditalini pasta in the back and reserve until soup is ready. Add to bowls when serving to avoid the pasta swelling and soaking up all the broth.
7. Optional: grate a Brazil nut like cheese to really blow your mind

Fall Farro Salad with Apples and Delicata 
RECIPE
SERVES 6
Ready in about 40 minutes
Ingredients 8 oz farro cooked according to package
3 apples cored and chopped in small cubes
3 lemons
1/4 cup toasted pecan pieces
1 delicata squash seeded and chopped
3 celery stalks chopped small
6 tbsp olive oil
1 tablespoon dijon mustard
1 tbsp smoked paprika
1 tsp garlic powder
15 oz can white beans drained
2 tsp salt divided
3 tbsp maple syrup
1/2 bunch parsley whole for dressing with 2-3 tbsp reserved for chopping
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook Farro according to package and let cool
3. On a sheet pan add delicata squash pieces with 1 tsp olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder and 1/2 tsp salt. Mix well and spread in single layer. Bake for 20 minutes turning once halfway. Let cool
4. On another sheet pan add white beans, 1 tsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt and mix well. Spread in a single layer then bake for 25 minutes until beans are crispy and let cool
5. Make dressing by combining mustard, parsely, 4 tbsp olive oil, maple syrup, juice of 2 lemons, 1 tsp salt and blend until smooth.
6. Add juice of one lemon to chopped apples to prevent browning.
7. To a large bowl add cooked farro, apples, celery, roasted squash, crispy beans, chopped parsley, pecans and dressing. Mix well.
8. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality.

Autumn Butternut, Bean & Bulgur Salad

Does healthy mean bland or delicious in your opinion?

You are going to love this tabouli inspired recipe. I wanted to call it Southwest Tabouli but I thought some people may get annoyed at the poetic license. This one is so good even my husband loved it. He likes a good salad but often tells me if it seems “too healthy”. This one is just the right amount of flavorful and healthy to keep us all happy. Try it and thank me later!

Serves 6
Ready in about 40 minutes
Ingredients:
3 cups butternut squash cubed
5 tbsp olive oil divided
2 tsp salt divided
8 oz bulgur cooked according to package
2 limes juiced
1 tbsp smoked paprika
1 tsp garlic powder
1 pinch chipotle chili flakes (optional)
1 bunch cilantro chopped
1/2 bunch cilantro for dressing
1 cup frozen corn
2 15 oz cans black beans drained
10 cherry tomatoes quartered
1/2 English cucumber or 1 mall cucumber peeled and diced small
1/4 cup toasted pumpkin seeds
2 tbsp maple syrup
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook bulgur according to package, let cool.
3. On a large sheet pan add cubed butternut, 1 tbsp olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, 1 tsp salt, and optional chipotle chili flakes. Mix and spread in a single layer. Bake for 20 minutes until tender.
4. Make the dressing by adding to a blender 1/2 bunch cilantro, remaining olive oil, remaining salt, maple syrup and lime juice. Blend until smooth.
5. Assemble the salad. In a large bowl add bulgur, cucumber, tomato, beans, corn, butternut, cilantro and pumpkin seeds. Pour the dressing over the top and toss well.
6. Enjoy within 3-4 days for best quality.

HARVEST WILD RICE SALAD

Do you love brussels sprouts?

You will love this Autumn salad recipe🍁 With crispy brussels sprouts, sweet roasted butternut squash, crunchy pecans and pomegranate arils you may “Fall” in love🤣 This one is your Vegan Holiday salad dish that will wow the fam and finally get them to eat their veggies

The full recipe is below but if you comment FALL SALAD I will dm you the printable link!

Serves 6
Ready in 1 hour
Ingredients:
8oz dry wild rice 
For Roasted veg:
1 pound brussels sprouts halved
2 cups butternut squash cubed
1 package tempeh cubed
1 tbsp olive oil
1/2 tsp salt
2 tbsp maple syrup
For dressing:
3 tbsp apple cider vinegar
3 tbsp olive oil
2 tsp maple syrup
1/2 tsp smoked paprika
1/4 tsp salt
Black pepper
Garnish
3 sprigs fresh thyme leaves only
1/2 cup pecans
1/4 cup pomegranate arils
Instructions:
1. Cook wild rice according to package and let cool
2. Preheat oven to 400
3. Spray a sheet pan with olive oil then spread brussels sprouts, butternut squash, and tempeh in a single layer. Spray with oil and sprinkle with salt then bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and drizzle with maple syrup then bake an additional 10 minutes. Let cool
4. Make dressing by combining apple cider vinegar, olive oil, maple syrup, salt, smoked paprika and pepper and blend until emulsified.
5. Layer wild rice and veggies in a large bowl. Add pomegranate, pecans and thyme leaves then toss with the dressing.
6. Enjoy within 4 days for best quality.

Autumn Kale Salad
Recipe:
Serves: 4
Ready in 30 minutes
Ingredients:
For Crispy Chickpeas and Delicate Squash
1 Delicata squash cut in half moons
1 15-oz can chickpeas drained
1 tsp smoked paprika
1/2 tsp salt
1 tbsp maple syrup
For Dressing:
2 tbsp olive oil
2 tbsp maple syrup
1 lemon juiced
2 tsp dijon mustard
Fresh black pepper
3 sprigs fresh thyme leaves only
10 leaves fresh mint
For Salad
1/2 bunch Dinosaur Kale about 2 cups
2 cups arugula
2 cups shredded red cabbage
1 large apple sliced 
1/4 cup pecans
1/4 cup pumpkin seeds
Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees
2. Combine delicata squash, chickpeas, smoked paprika, salt and maple syrup. Spread on a single layer on a sheet pan and bake for 20 minutes turning once halfway. Let cool.
3. Make dressing by combining olive oil, maple syrup, lemon, dijon mustard, black pepper, mint and thyme. Blend until smooth.
4. In a large bowl add kale, arugula, cabbage, apple, roasted squash and chickpeas plus pecans and pumpkin seeds. Pour dressing over and toss well until coated.

QUINOA AND LENTIL TABBOULEH
This plant-powered salad recipe is full of Mediterranean flavors like parsley and lemon but instead of bulgur wheat it has higher protein quinoa and black lentils! This recipe is easy and quick to make and tastes delicious.

What you need:
-Black Lentils 
-Quinoa
-Red Cabbage
-Parsley
-Persian Cucumbers
-Cherry Tomatoes
-Zuchinni
-Extra Virgin Olive Oil
-Lemon
-salt and pepper
Instructions:
-Boil the lentils until soft (about 25 minutes) drain, rinse with cold water and drain again. 
-Cook the Quinoa according to the package and let cool
-Chop the parsley, cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes and grate the zuchinni
-In a bowl add the lentils, quinoa, and chopped veggies and herbs.
Drizzle the olive oil, squeeze the lemon, add salt and pepper then mix until well combined.

MEATY VEGAN STUFFED SHELLS
Wanna try?
Almost anything can be veganized. This recipe proves my point.
Recipe:
SERVES 6
Ready in 1.5 hours
Ingredients:
* yellow onion diced
* 6 cloves garlic minced
* 6 baby bell peppers multicolor, seeded and chopped
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* 16 oz vegan ground beef any brand you like..
* 16 oz firm tofu crumbled
* 2 tbsp nutritional yeast
* 2 tbsp hemp hearts
* 22 oz crushed tomatoes
* 1 tbsp italian seasoning
* 1 ½ tsp salt
* ½ tsp turbinado sugar optional
* 1 cup raw cashews soaked for 3 hours or overnight
* ¾ cup water
* 2 cup kale stemmed and shredded
* 1 cup vegan cheese 
* 16 oz large shell pasta
* 1 ea black pepper to taste
INSTRUCTIONS
* First, Make the sauce. In a large saucepan over medium heat add the oil. Once hot, add the garlic, onions and peppers and cook for 5 minutes until fragrant and browning. Add the vegan “ground beef”, season with a pinch of salt and break it apart into small pieces in the pan and cook until it turns brown and solid just like beef does. It will take about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes, Italian seasoning, salt and sugar if using. Simmer for 10 minutes. 
* Cook the pasta according to the box, drain well and rinse with cold water so that it is easy to handle. Reserve until the assembly step.
* Make the “ricotta” in a large bowl by combining tofu, nutritional yeast, hemp hearts, and kale. Blend the cashews and water in a blender until creamy and pourable and add to the bowl with the tofu and other ingredients. Mix until well combined.
* Preheat oven to 375
* Assemble the shells. In an oven safe lasagna pan place several ladle fulls of sauce on the bottom of the pan to nest the filled shells on. Using a scoop or tablespoon fill each cooked shell with about 1 oz of the tofu ricotta filling. Continue until all the shells are filled. Top with remaining sauce and vegan shredded cheese. Cover the pan with tin foil and bake for 45 minutes until the cheese on top is melted and the sauce is bubbly. 
* Serve piping hot and garnish with fresh black pepper.
* Enjoy for up to 5 days when stored properly in the refrigerator.

PUMPKIN CHILI MAC

What’s your favorite way to eat pumpkin?🎃

This fun Fall recipe is the marriage between Chil and Mac&Cheese and you need it in your life! 

RECIPE:
Ready in 30 minutes
Serves 6
1 pound pasta
1 vegan smoked cheddar wheel grated (8oz)
1/4 cup chopped cilantro
1 lime cut in wedges
1 tbsp olive oil
1 small sugarpie pumpkin seeded, peeled and cut in cubes (about 2 cups total)
1 yellow onion small dice
4 red baby bell peppers chopped
2 jalapenos seeded and chopped
3 tbsp tomato paste
2 cups water
2 cans pinto beans rinsed and drains
1 cup frozen corn
1 tbsp chili powder
1 tsp salt
1 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp smoked paprika
1 tsp cumin
Instructions:
1. Cook Pasta on the back burner and reserve.
2. Heat a large saucepan over medium heat and add olive oil. Saute pumpkin for 5 minutes stirring occasionally to get some color.
3. Add onions, peppers and jalapeño and continue to cook stirring occasionally for 8-10 minutes until onions are fragrant and translucent and peppers are soft. Pumpkin will be almost cooked thru
4. Add tomato paste, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, cumin and garlic powder and cook stirring often for 5 minutes. The tomato paste will darken and caramelize.
5. Add water, corn and pinto beans, stir and cover. Cook for 10 minutes covered stirring every 3-4 minutes to make sure there is no burning on the bottom.
6. While Chili Cooks, grate Smoked Cheddar Wheels on a box grater and reserve.
7. Check that pumpkin in the chili is fork tender, if so, it is finished. Add Cilantro if desired
8. In a bowl, layer chili, cheese, pasta, more chili, cheese and pasta. Stir then garnish with cilantro and lime wedge.

EASY AIR-FRIED VEGAN EGGROLLS 😍 by @betterfoodguru. Crispy, crunchy, and healthier than the original - I’ll take 20, please! 😋🍽️

I N G R E D I E N T S
(Makes 12 eggrolls)

◻️12 vegan eggroll wrappers
◻️1 block extra firm tofu drained, pressed and cubed
◻️4 cups pre-cut coleslaw mix (green cabbage, carrots and purple cabbage)
◻️2 cloves garlic minced
◻️1 tbsp dark soy sauce
◻️2 tbsp light sodium soy sauce
◻️1 tbsp toasted sesame oil
◻️oil of choice for spraying
◻️2 tsp ginger minced

D I R E C T I O N S

1. In a large and deep skillet, heat the sesame oil over medium heat and then add the crumbled tofu. Set the timer for 5 minutes and do not move the tofu until it sounds.

2. Stir the tofu and then make space in the center of the pan to add the garlic and ginger. Cook without stirring for 2-3 minutes then mix into the tofu mixture.

3. Add the dark soy sauce and cook for 2-3 minutes stirring to distribute throughout the tofu mixture. It will resemble ground pork.

4. Add the shredded coleslaw veggies and the light soy sauce. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring often. Then turn off the heat and let the mix cool.

 5. Set up a station to make the eggrolls with the wrappers and a small bowl of water to dip your fingers in to seal the little eggroll packages.

6. One at a time, take a wrapper and put about 3 tbsp of the filling in the middle and spread it horizontally in a line. Fold the sides up around the mixture slightly and then roll the side closest to you around the mixture. It is very similar to rolling a burrito. Use your finger to wet the edge to make a seal once you have made your little package. Do this with all 12.

7. Once finished, spray the air fryer basket with oil and place the eggrolls inside. Depending on the size of your air-fryer, this may take two rounds of cooking. Do not let the eggrolls touch one another. 

8. Spray the tops with oil and then air fry at 400 degrees for 5 minutes. Carefully flip them with tongs and air-fry for an additional 5 minutes.

9. Serve with dipping sauce of choice. I like Thai sweet chili sauce, hoisin or soy sauce.

VEGAN CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES
These are the easiest cookies I ever made. They have a chewy texture and the perfect ratio of chip to cookie. Make them in a flash with no extra equipment.  These are a godsend to peeps who don’t love baking (like me) Try them and thank me later🍪

RECIPE
Makes 12 large cookies
Cooks in 12 minutes
Ingredients:
1 tbsp chia seeds
5.5 tbsp water
1/2 cup vegan butter melted
2 cups spelt flour
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup gf oats
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
6 oz vegan chocolate chips
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350
2. Make chia egg by combining chia seeds with 1.5 tbsp water and let sit while assembling the rest of ingredients
3. Melt the vegan butter in a microwave safe bowl for 25-30 second
4. In a large bowl, add melted vegan butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar and combine
5. Add baking soda, vanilla extract, salt, and chia egg and combine
6. Add spelt flour, oats and water and mix well
7. Last fold in the chocolate chips
8. On a large baking sheet spoon the cookie mixture into 12 large cookies. Give them ample room to spread while cooking.
9. Cook fro 12-15 minutes depending on how you like your cookies. 12 minutes for chewy and 15 for more crispy.

DELICATA SQUASH SALAD
RECIPE
Serves 7 sides
Ready in 40 minutes
Ingredients:
4 delicata squash seeded and cut in half moons
3 tsp olive oil, divided
1 tsp salt divided
1 tsp garlic powder divided
1 tsp smoked paprika divided
1 can chickpeas drained
1 Bunch Dino Kale chopped bite sized pieces
3 tbsp pumpkin seeds
1/2 cup tahini
3 mandarin oranges juiced
1 lemon juiced
3/4 cup water
1 tbsp plus 1 tsp maple syrup divided
1 tbsp fresh thyme leaves
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400
On a large sheet pan lay out delicata squash in a single layer. Drizzle or spray with olive oil and season with ¼ tsp salt and ½ tsp garlic powder. Bake for 30 minutes turning once halfway.
On another sheet pan add chickpeas, 1 tsp olive oil, 1 tbsp maple syrup, ¼ tsp salt and ½ tsp smoked paprika. Toss until well mixed then bake for 20 minutes turning once halfway.
While they are baking make the Orange, maple tahini sauce by adding tahini, lemon, orange, water , fresh thyme, ½ tsp garlic powder, maple syrup and ¼ tsp salt and blending until smooth and creamy.
Spread kale on another sheet pan and spray with remaining oil and season with a pinch of salt. Bake for 5-7 minutes until crisp.
Layer the crispy kale, delicata and chickpeas in a bowl. Drizzle with half the sauce and put out the other half in a small bowl for drizzling. You will want more! Garnish with fresh thyme. Serve this warm or room temp.

Recipe
Serves 6
Ready in 1 hour
Ingredients:
2 cups cooked brown rice cooled
2 cups shredded Cole slaw mix (red  and green cabbage, carrots)
2 romaine hearts cut in bite sized pieces
FOR CRISPY CHICKPEAS
1 15 oz can chickpeas drained
1 tsp olive oil
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp smoked paprika
FOR CAJUN TOFU
1 block extra firm tofu drained well
3 tsp cajun spice
A few sprays of olive oil
FOR DRESSING:
1 cup raw cashew pieces
6 each Brazil nuts
1 lemon juiced
1/4 tsp vegan Worcestershire
1 pinch seaweed flakes
2 tbsp olive oil
4 tbsp water
1/2 tsp salt
1 clove garlic
Pinch of Black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. Cook Brown Rice according to package and let cool. I like to cook large batches in the beginning of the week and keep it refrigerated for recipes like this one and sides for warm bowls. You can also use frozen prepared brown rice. Just be sure to let it cool before combining with the lettuce.
3. On a large sheet pan MAKE CRISPY CHICKPEAS by combining chickpeas with oil, salt, garlic powder and smoked paprika and spread in a single layer.

6. MAKE THE DRESSING: combine soaked and drained cashews, Brazil nuts, lemon, vegan Worcestershire, seaweed flakes, olive oil, water, salt, garlic and pepper in a blender and puree until smooth and creamy. If the dressing is too thick (because lemons vary) add an extra tablespoon of water to loosen it up and blend again.
7. In a large bowl, add cooled brown rice, romaine, Cole slaw mix, crispy chickpeas, cajun tofu and dressing.
8. Eat within 2 days. For a longer shelf life of 4 days, substitute chopped kale for the romaine. This is an excellent salad for food prep if you keep the dressing separate and dress it right before eating. It also makes a KILLER “chicken” Caesar wrap

Recipe:
Creamy Butternut Squash Curry
Serves 4
Prep:15 minutes
Cook: 30 minutes
1 small yellow onion, diced small
3 cloves garlic minced
2 inch nub of fresh ginger minced
2 tablespoons olive oil
3 cups butternut squash peeled and cubed
15 ounce can chickpeas drained
1 cup crushed tomatoes
1 cup water
2 tablespoons curry powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1/2 teaspoon garam masala
1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
Fresh Ground black pepper to taste
1/2 cup Forager Project plain cashew yogurt
2 cups baby spinach chopped small
1/2 bunch cilantro chopped
Instructions:
In a large, deep skillet, heat oil over medium heat then add onion, garlic and ginger and cook for 5 minutes until fragrant.
Add butternut squash and cook for 5 minutes stirring often.
Add curry powder, cumin, salt, coriander and garam masala and cook for 5 more minutes stirring often.
Add tomatoes, chickpeas and water and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes until butternut is fork tender.
Add spinach, cilantro and stir until spinach is wilted and turn off heat.
Add yogurt and mix well. Serve with garnish of cilantro, black pepper and a dollop of yogurt.

Recipe

Ingredients:

“Sausage” and Kale Soup
Recipe
Ready in about 45 minutes
Serves 6
Ingredients:
2 tbsp olive oil
1 block tempeh crumbled into tiny pieces
4 garlic cloves minced
1/2 onion chopped
3 carrots peeled and diced
3 celery stalks chopped small
1 fennel bulb diced
1 15-oz can chickpeas
1 15-oz can crushed tomatoes
4 fresh tomatoes chopped 
10 cups water
2 tbsp Italian seasoning
2 tsp salt plus more to taste
2 tablespoons smoked paprika
2 tbsp nooch
Black pepper to taste
1 bunch kale stemmed and chopped
Instructions:
1. In a large soup pot, heat oil over medium heat and add tempeh and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes until garlic is very fragrant.
2. Add 1 tsp salt and smoked paprika and cook for 2 minutes then add onions and fennel and cook for 5 minutes stirring often to avoid sticking
3. Add celery and carrots and tomatoes, 1 tsp salt and pepper to your liking and cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes are releasing their juices.
4. Add italian seasoning, water, chickpeas and canned tomatoes and bring to a boil. 
5. Simmer for 20 minutes then add kale and nutritional yeast.
6. Serve with nutritional yeast and black pepper garnish.
7. Always let soup cool to room temp before covering and storing in the fridge. Soup is good for 5 days for best quality or frozen for up to 3 months.

Italian Eggplant Pasta Bake
Recipe
servings 6
Ready in 1 hour
Ingredients:
16 oz rigatoni
22 oz crushed tomatoes
16 oz water
2 eggplants cut in thin slices and then quartered
1 tsp garlic powder
1 onion
3 cloves garlic
4 baby bell peppers cut in strips
3 tbsp olive oil
2 tsp Italian seasoning
1 tsp salt
1 block firm tofu crumbled
1 block @GoodPLANetfoods Italian Style Mozzarella Cheese, grated on a box grater
2-3 leaves fresh basil chopped for garnish
Instructions:
1.Preheat oven to 400 degrees
To a sheet pan add eggplant, garlic powder, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 pinch salt, 1 tbsp olive oil and toss well. Spread in a single layer and bake for 20 minutes.
2. Put on water to boil for pasta. Cook pasta al dente and reserve for assembly.
3. Make the sauce. In a large and deep sauce pan heat remaining olive oil, add onion and garlic and cook for 4 minutes until fragrant. Then add peppers and cook 5 more minutes.
